^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

DriveLocationFormat.description: The format of the physical drive locations on this controller

enumDescriptions.ControllerPort:Box:Bay: The drives are specified in the <controller port: box: bay> format
enumDescriptions.ControllerPort:Box:Bay[|ControllerPort:B: The drives are specified in the <controller port: box: bay> format, with an optional alternate location delineated by a pipe

Oem.description: This is the manufacturer/provider specific extension moniker used to divide the Oem object into sections
Oem.longDescription: The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Oem*

DataGuard.description: The value of the field indicates whether or not data destructive actions are allowed on the controller

enumDescriptions.Strict: Data destructive actions are not allowed
enumDescriptions.Permissive: Logical drive delete actions will be ignored

Actions.description: An array of actions to perform on the controller

enumDescriptions.ClearConfigurationMetadata: Clear the configuration metadata from physical drives that are masked from the OS
enumDescriptions.FactoryReset: Reset the controller to factory settings by performing the following: delete all logical drives, remove all license keys, clear the encryption configuration, clear the controller NVRAM, and clear configuration metadata from all physical drives that are masked from the OS

enumDescriptions.PhysicalDriveErase: Erase the physical drives specified in the PhysicalDriveList

enumDescriptions.PhysicalDriveEnable: Enables the physical drives specified in the PhysicalDriveList

ErasePattern.description: The erase pattern used to erase the drive

enumDescriptions.SanitizeRestrictedBlockErase: Use the restricted block erase sanitize block erase method to erase a drive
enumDescriptions.SanitizeUnrestrictedBlockErase: Use the unrestricted block erase sanitize method to erase a drive
enumDescriptions.SanitizeRestrictedOverwrite: Use the restricted overwrite sanitize method to erase a drive
enumDescriptions.SanitizeUnrestrictedOverwrite: Use the unrestricted overwrite sanitize method to erase a drive
enumDescriptions.SanitizeRestrictedCryptoScramble: Use the unrestricted cryptographic scramble sanitize method to erase a drive
enumDescriptions.SanitizeUnrestrictedCryptoScramble: Use the unrestricted cryptographic scramble sanitize method to erase a drive
enumDescriptions.OnePass: Use the controller-based one pass erase method that writes zeroes to every sector of the drive
enumDescriptions.TwoPass: Use the controller-based two pass erase method that writes random data to every sector of the drive on the first pass, and zeroes on the second pass
enumDescriptions.ThreePass: Use the controller-based three pass erase method that writes random data to every sector of the drive on the first two passes, and zeroes on the third pass

PhysicalDriveList.description: A list of the physical drives to be erased

items.description: Physical drive in the format specified in DriveLocationFormat

LocationFormat.description: The format of the Location property on this controller

enumDescriptions.PCISlot: The location of the controller is given as a PCI slot number

PowerModeAfterReboot.description: The power mode of the controller after a reboot

enumDescriptions.Invalid: The controller will be operating in an unknown power mode after a reboot
enumDescriptions.MinPower: The controller will be operating in minimum power mode after a reboot
enumDescriptions.Balanced: The controller will be operating in a balanced mode after a reboot
enumDescriptions.MaxPerformance: The controller will be operating in maximum performance power mode after a reboot

enumDescriptions.Enabled: The controller will throttle dynamic power settings to their minimum when temperatures exceed the warning threshold
enumDescriptions.Disabled: The controller will not throttle dynamic power settings

ExpandPriority.description: The level of priority that transformations have over handling current operating system requests

enumDescriptions.High: Transformations will complete as fast as possible at the expense of normal I/O
enumDescriptions.Medium: Transformations will perform with some impact on normal I/O
enumDescriptions.Low: Transformations will perform only when normal I/O is not occurring and may take longer to complete

RebuildPriority.description: The level of priority that rebuilds have over handling current operating system requests

enumDescriptions.High: Rebuilds will complete as fast as possible at the expense of normal I/O
enumDescriptions.MediumHigh: Rebuilds will perform with an impact on normal I/O (only allowed if RapidRebuild is supported)
enumDescriptions.Medium: Rebuilds will perform with some impact on normal I/O
enumDescriptions.Low: Rebuilds will perform only when normal I/O is not occurring and may take longer to complete

SurfaceScanAnalysisPriority.description: Priority that the controller takes to find and correct disk surface errors

enumDescriptions.Disabled: Surface scan is disabled and may lead to data loss
enumDescriptions.High: Surface scan commands will be sent with the host I/O, resulting in faster scanning, but may inpact host I/O performance
enumDescriptions.Idle: Surface scan commands will ony be issued when no host I/O is present after a delay

SurfaceScanAnalysisDelaySeconds.description: Sets the delay of the controller before beginning surface scan analysis. Only valid if SurfaceScanAnalysisPriority is Idle

CurrentParallelSurfaceScanCount.description: This indicates the number of parallel surface scans the controller allows

DriveWriteCache.description: Enables or disables the write cache of the configured physical drives attached to the controller

enumDescriptions.Enabled: The write cache of the configured physical drives attached to the controller is enabled
enumDescriptions.Disabled: The write cache of the configured physical drives attached to the controller is disabled
enumDescriptions.Default: The write cache of the configured physical drives attached to the controller is set by the controller (this feature may not be supported on all controllers)

DriveWriteCacheUnconfigured.description: Enables or disables the write cache of the unconfigured physical drives attached to the controller

enumDescriptions.Enabled: The write cache of the unconfigured physical drives attached to the controller is enabled
enumDescriptions.Disabled: The write cache of the unconfigured physical drives attached to the controller is disabled
enumDescriptions.Default: The write cache of the unconfigured physical drives attached to the controller is set by the controller (this feature may not be supported on all controllers)

PredictiveSpareRebuild.description: Enables or disables predictive spare rebuild mode

enumDescriptions.Enabled: Spare drives will replace physical drives that are predicted to fail preemptively
enumDescriptions.Disabled: Spare drives will replace physical drives only when they fail

MonitorAndPerformanceAnalysisDelaySecond.description: This sets the monitor and performance delay on the controller. Valid values range from 0 to 1440 seconds. Set to 60 seconds for default settings and 0 seconds for video-on-demand optimized setting

NoBatteryWriteCache.description: This indicates if the controller will continue to use write cache even if the backup power source is not available

enumDescriptions.Enabled: The controller will continue to use write cache even if the backup power source is not available
enumDescriptions.Disabled: The controller will not continue to use write cache even if the backup power source is not available

ReadCachePercent.description: This indicates the percentage of cache used for read cache on the controller, with the rest of the cache being used for write cache

DegradedPerformanceOptimization.description: Enables the controller to attempt to improve performance on RAID 5/50/6(ADG)/60 logical drives when one or more physical drives in the logical drive are failed

enumDescriptions.Enabled: The controller will attempt to improve performance by buffering physical drive requests
enumDescriptions.Disabled: The controller will not buffer, which may result in reading from the same drive multiple times

ElevatorSort.description: Enables the controller to sort requests to a physical drive

enumDescriptions.Enabled: The controller will sort the requests to minimize the amount of seeking the drive must perform in order to reduce seek times
enumDescriptions.Disabled: The controller will perform the requests as they are recieved in order to improve request throughput

InconsistencyRepairPolicy.description: Enables the controller to update data on RAID 6(ADG) and 60 volumes based on parity information when an inconsistency is discovered during surface scan

enumDescriptions.Enabled: The controller will update the data on the drives based on the parity information
enumDescriptions.Disabled: The controller will only update the parity information and leave the data untouched

QueueDepth.description: This sets the maximum number of requests the controller will submit to a drive at any given time

enumDescriptions.Automatic: Automatically determine the best queue depth for the controller

FlexibleLatencySchedulerSetting.description: This allows the controller to process certain high-latency requests after a delay that may time out when elevator sorting

enumDescriptions.Default: The controller will rely only on elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Low250: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 250ms when suspending elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Middle100: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 100ms when suspending elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Middle50: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 50ms when suspending elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Aggressive30: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 30ms when suspending elevator sorting
enumDescriptions.Aggressive10: The controller will apply a cutoff value of 10ms when suspending elevator sorting

WriteCacheBypassThresholdKiB.description: This value sets the write cache bypass threshold, ranging from 16 KiB to 1040 KiB in multiples of 16 KiB, where all writes larger than the specified value in KiB units will bypass the write cache and be written directly to the disk for non-parity RAID volumes

EncryptionConfiguration.description: This indicates the type of encryption configured on the controller

enumDescriptions.ExpressLocal: Express local encryption is configured and the controller is being encrypted with internally generated keys
enumDescriptions.None: Encryption is not configured on the controller

EncryptionEULA.description: The value of this field indicates whether or not the user has accepted the encryption EULA

enumDescriptions.Accept: The user has read and accepted the encryption EULA
enumDescriptions.Decline: The user has not read and accepted the encryption EULA

LegacyBootPriority.description: The boot priority of this logical drive

enumDescriptions.Primary: This logical drive is the primary boot volume
enumDescriptions.Secondary: This logical drive is the secondary boot volume
enumDescriptions.All: This logical drive is both the primary and secondary boot volume
enumDescriptions.None: This logical drive has no legacy boot priority

CapacityGiB.description: Total usable capacity available on this logical drive in GiB units. Set to -1 to use all remaining space for maximum size

CapacityBlocks.description: Total usable capacity available on this logical drive in block units. Set to -1 to use all remaining space for maximum size

SpareRebuildMode.description: Type of spare drive used with this logical drive

enumDescriptions.Dedicated: The spare drive temporarily takes over a failed data drive; when the failed data drive is replaced, the spare drive becomes idle again
enumDescriptions.Roaming: The spare drive replaces the failed data drive

ParityGroupCount.description: The number of parity groups to use in the logical drive; only valid for certain RAID levels

ParityInitializationType.description: When creating a logical drive with a RAID level that requires parity, parity blocks can be initialized with two different methods

enumDescriptions.Default: Parity blocks are initialized in the background and the logical drive is available during this time
enumDescriptions.Rapid: Both data and parity blocks are initialized in the foreground and the logical drive will not be available to the operating system until initialization completes

BlockSizeBytes.description: The block size of the disk drive in bytes

Raid.description: The current RAID level configured on the logical drive

enumDescriptions.Raid0: There is no fault tolerance used on this logical drive
enumDescriptions.Raid1: Two sets of duplicate data is being stored on a pair of drives
enumDescriptions.Raid1ADM: Three sets of duplicate data is being stored on a trio of drives
enumDescriptions.Raid10: Data is duplicated and striped across pairs of disk drives
enumDescriptions.Raid10ADM: Data is duplicated and striped across trios of disk drives
enumDescriptions.Raid5: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing parity data across 3 or more disk drives
enumDescriptions.Raid50: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing parity data and striping the data across 6 or more disk drives
enumDescriptions.Raid6: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing multiple sets parity data across 4 or more disk drives
enumDescriptions.Raid60: Fault tolerance is achieved by storing multiple sets parity data and striping the data across 8 or more disk drives

StripSizeBytes.description: The strip size of the logical drive in bytes

StripeSizeBytes.description: The stripe size of the logical drive in bytes

Accelerator.description: The acceleration method of the logical drive

enumDescriptions.ControllerCache: Read and writes to the logical drive are being cached by the controller
enumDescriptions.IOBypass: For logical drives on SSDs, read and write information directly from the drive

LogicalDriveName.description: Label given to the logical drive

oneOf.description: A list of the physical drives to be used in the logical drive

items.description: Physical drive in the format specified in DriveLocationFormat

oneOf.description: A list of properties defining a drive set

DataDriveCount.description: Specify the number of data drives for this logical drive

DataDriveMediaType.description: Specify the media type for the data drives for this logical drive

enumDescriptions.HDD: Use spindle drives when creating the logical drive
enumDescriptions.SSD: Use solid state drives when creating the logical drive

DataDriveInterfaceType.description: Specify the interface type for the data drives for this logical drive

enumDescriptions.SAS: Use SAS drives when creating the logical drive
enumDescriptions.SATA: Use SATA drives when creating the logical drive
enumDescriptions.NVMe: Use NVMe drives when creating the logical drive

DataDriveMinimumSizeGiB.description: Specify the minimum size for the data drive(s) used to create the logical drive

DataDriveBlockSize.description: Specify the block size of the data drives for this logical drive

enumDescriptions.512: Use drives with a logical block size of 512 bytes per block
enumDescriptions.4096: Use drives with a logical block size of 4096 bytes per block

DataDriveLocation.description: Specify the location of the data drives for this logical drive

enumDescriptions.Internal: Drives that are attached to an internal port of the controller (front drives)
enumDescriptions.External: Drives that are attached to an external port of the controller (JBOD drives)

oneOf.description: A list of the physical drives to be used as spares for the logical drive

items.description: Physical drive in the format specified in DriveLocationFormat

oneOf.description: A list of properties defining a spare drive set

SpareDriveCount.description: Specify the number of spare drives for this logical drive

Actions.description: An array of actions to perform on the logical drive

enumDescriptions.LogicalDriveDelete: Delete the logical drive even if DataGuard is Permissive

LegacyBootPriority.description: The boot priority of this physical drive

enumDescriptions.Primary: This physical drive is the primary boot volume
enumDescriptions.Secondary: This physical drive is the secondary boot volume
enumDescriptions.All: This physical drive is both the primary and secondary boot volume
enumDescriptions.None: This physical drive has no legacy boot priority

OperatingModeAfterReboot.description: The operating mode of this port after a reboot

enumDescriptions.Mixed: The port will be functioning in mixed mode after rebooting. Unassigned drives will be exposed to the OS
